s.text: Reviews praise the movie's depiction of the repressed Japanese middle class and its "Fred and Ginger sweetness" (Janet Maslin, the New York Times ). But some critics complain it's too languid and drawn out.
Critics foresee art-house success for this film about a buttoned-down Japanese accountant whose midlife crisis drives him to take dance lessons.
Critics foresee art-house success for this film about a buttoned-down Japanese accountant whose midlife crisis drives him to take dance lessons.
Other critics predict that Roar , like Xena , will be a cult hit.

Book -- Without a Doubt , by Marcia Clark, with Teresa Carpenter;
Book -- The Perfect Storm , by Sebastian Junger;
Book -- Firewall: The Iran-Contra Conspiracy and Cover-Up , by Lawrence E. Walsh;
